info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...BEAVER...WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN LAWRENCE...WESTERN ALLEGHENY...GREENE...WESTERN FAYETTE...OHIO...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 347 PM EDT, snow showers were located along a line extending from near Lisbon to near Avella to near Hundred. Movement was east at 25 mph. Locations impacted include... Moon Township, McMurray, Weirton, Steubenville, Washington, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Canonsburg, Beaver Falls, Monaca, East Palestine, and Waynesburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in West Virginia near mile marker 14. Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 29. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 2 and 13. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 8 and 55. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 19 and 62. Snow will lead to reduced visibilities and worsening travel conditions. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this intense snow shower. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
